Interface_name: WebSocket Client-side based on browser native API in JavaScript
Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a WebSocket client class that manages WebSocket connections with automatic reconnection capabilities, message handling, and connection state management.

Class Description: The WebSocketClient class provides a wrapper around the browser's native WebSocket API with additional features for connection management. It handles connection establishment, automatic reconnection on failure, message processing, and clean disconnection.

Attributes:
- DISCONNECT_TIMEOUT: [Number] - Timeout duration (in milliseconds) before disconnecting
- RECONNECT_TIMEOUT: [Number] - Timeout duration (in milliseconds) before attempting to reconnect
- wsState: [Number] - Current state of the WebSocket connection (CLOSED, CONNECTING, OPEN)
- ws: [WebSocket|null] - The active WebSocket connection instance
- wsURL: [String] - URL for the WebSocket server connection
- connectTS: [Number] - Timestamp of the last connection attempt
- disconnectTID: [Number] - Timeout ID for disconnection
- reconnectTID: [Number] - Timeout ID for reconnection
- onmessage: [Object|null] - Callback functions for incoming messages

Methods:
- onconnect() -> [Boolean] - Initiates a new WebSocket connection. Returns true if connection attempt was made.
- ondisconnect() -> [void] - Closes the current WebSocket connection and cleans up resources.
- onopen([Event] e) -> [void] - Handles WebSocket connection open event and sets up message listeners.
- onclose() -> [Boolean] - Handles WebSocket connection close event and schedules reconnection. Returns true if reconnection was scheduled.
- send([Object] e) -> [void] - Sends a JSON-serialized message through the WebSocket connection.
- reconnect() -> [void] - Forces reconnection by closing existing connection (if any) and initiating a new one.
